p: Where possible, animal prey types were identified to the order-level (‘Coleoptera’, ‘Hemiptera’, ‘Orthoptera’ and ‘Lepidoptera’). Non-identified arthropods were categorized as ‘other arthropods’. In ‘Lepidoptera’, we distinguished between ‘caterpillars’ and ‘moths’, since caterpillars are an important food source during chick rearing in most passerine bird species (Thiollay 1988; Greenberg 1995). Plant food types, pollen and nectar, both food sources of flower visiting birds, were combined into the category ‘nectar’. Other categories were ‘fruit’ and ‘seed’.
